channel.title: Water damaged iPhone 4
channel.description:
Went to a party last night, ended up getting wasted, and then proceeded to end up in the swimming pool with my phone in my pocket. Got straight out and the phone had turned itself off under the water. As I was at a house party I dried it off and put it in the airing cupboard. Now am back home and have it in a bag of rice hoping it will take the moisture, but I don't have high hopes. Going to leave it for a few days.
I stupidly dried plugging it in to a power source to see if it would turn on that way, but I guess that probably wasn't the smartest move. The water damage indicator is half red half white.
Anyone got any good ideas that might save my phone? Would prevent so much hassle if I could dry it out.
Thanks

item.title: Water damaged iPhone 4
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Mr.Chris:

Hmm, you rekon? All up for trying, but nearest Apple store to me is probably Brighton, which is a bit of a journey only to get turned down. I have an acquaintance at the store in Regent Street, might see if she’ll do me a favour…

yeah if you know soemone its even easier

item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

they do say that as a general rule but they replace them on a regular basis, one of my flatmates works at one of the london sjops and he said they do just replace them if its the first time, id recommend going to a bigger shop as well just because they are often more friendly in there

item.title: Water damaged iPhone 4
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

So the company I sent it to contacted me today saying I needed a new dock and a new screen unit for the great price of £110 (haha). Told them to stick it and to send my phone back immedietely. Found an independant guy who has done some work on Macs for my dad, so will go and see him this week.

Otherwise, looks like I’m going to have to go through insurance and sort out another phone. Fucking annoying to say the least…

Read full topic

item.title: Water damaged iPhone 4
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

apple will replace the phone for free if its the first time you’ve had a water damage claim

Read full topic

item.title: Water damaged iPhone 4
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Haha, never!

Phone came completely back to life, only problem being the backlight seems to be fucked. Little bit of research said that it’s likely the coil needed replacing. Atm, it’s at an indepedant iphone repair business - They said it’s a common problem with water damaged iPhones and that a good clean out of the phone can usually mend it.

Should hopefully get the phone back on Monday if it works…

Read full topic

item.title: Water damaged iPhone 4
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Look on the bright side of things, at least you can take this opportunity to upgrade to an Android phone! Then if you swim with it you can remove the battery and save the phone.

Read full topic

item.title: Water damaged iPhone 4
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Some signs off life, but still wont turn on :/. Plugged in to USB on my laptop, and it recognized the phone, said that it needed to restore. Waiting for that to finish now…

Quick update:

Phone failed to restore and I was thrown an error. Now I’ve noticed that when I click the lock button, the screen will show some sign of dim lighting for a split second and then return to normal. The sound of a picture being taken when I click the lock and home button works, and so does the vibhration when I stick it in to silent. I’m also 100% sure I saw my home screen for a split second.

iTune recognises the phone, backs it up, syncs it, but it seems the screen just wont give me anything. Maybe the circuitry for the screen is fucked??

Anyway, going to leave it in the bag of rice for another day or so and see what happens…Fingers crossed!

Read full topic

That’s good, still you should just wait and see though.

Pain in the fucking arse if I lose all my jailbroken shit though.

item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Frell:

You know, water proof watches are completely common nowadays, what about cell phones?

They exist, my dad used to have a phone that you could submerse and it would be fine, it could also take one hell of a beating.

They usually have like no “modern” features though
